org.odk.collect.android.logic.actions.setgeopoint

Class CollectSetGeopointAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.javarosa.core.model.actions.Action
      • org.javarosa.core.model.actions.setgeopoint.SetGeopointAction
        • org.odk.collect.android.logic.actions.setgeopoint.CollectSetGeopointAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener, org.javarosa.core.util.externalizable.Externalizable

    public class CollectSetGeopointAction
extends org.javarosa.core.model.actions.setgeopoint.SetGeopointAction
implements com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    An Android-specific implementation of SetGeopointAction. When the action is triggered, the first location available is saved and the highest-accuracy reading within SECONDS_TO_CONSIDER_UPDATES seconds will replace it. If no location is available within SECONDS_TO_CONSIDER_UPDATES seconds, no location is written. It is possible for the same action to be triggered multiple times within SECONDS_TO_CONSIDER_UPDATES seconds if the action is triggered by a value changed event, for example. In that case, the highest accuracy reading resets each time the action is triggered. In a repeat, the target node for subsequent times the action is triggered could be different than the target node the first time it was triggered. In that case, only the current target node is updated.

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
        When the location updates, if location updates are allowed, no location has been received yet or the new location has a higher accuracy than previous locations, save the location in the model, matching the target node's type. If the background location preference is toggled to disabled while location is being acquired, the node receiving the location will be cleared.
        Specified by:
        onLocationChanged in interface com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
